Articles.Content:
SuicidalInsanity created this parts pack to Ã¢â‚¬Ëœflesh outÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ the stock selection of Mk. 2 parts by adding engines, fuselage segments and air intakes. A total of fifteen parts will be added once you download & install this mod in your game, each and every one of them adding more design possibilities. Best of all, thereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s no need to worry about your memory footprint: the mod uses stock textures which greatly reduces the amount of RAM this mod occupies, leaving you with few excuses to not check it out. wowowowowowowo

Daily Kerbal has arrived! I wonder what we'll see in the devnotes tomorrow...
Congrats to SuicidalInsanity for making Modding Mondays. Nice work.
The daily kerbal is back! (Also, I know that maybe one of the featured mods here has ever been made stock, but.... Squad plz)

Well. I can honestly say this was a welcome surprise today, one that will motive me to work even harder on future updates. Thanks, SQUAD! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Squad pls.. you know how much SP+ did for spaceplanes? This does that. Pls into stock ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

While I can see how even more spaceplane parts would appeal to some and might be needed, can we have the pure space parts (You know kerbal SPACE program?) given some love first?

An ever increasing set of parts to improve design options for atmospheric flight does nothing for many players except increase their memory footprint.

Once we get a stable 64 bit version then we need ALL the parts of course.

Until then?

Not so much.

That said, these look like some sweet parts for those who focus on spaceplanes.

> 
> wowowowowowowo
> Daily Kerbal has arrived! I wonder what we'll see in the devnotes tomorrow...

I wouldn't get my hopes up for anything but "We're still fixing the 1.0 release".

> 
> I wouldn't get my hopes up for anything but "We're still fixing the 1.0 release".

Still fixing 1.0.2, more parts to add, lots of rebalancing going on, more missions to add. Unity 5.0 eventually, but don't hold your breath that will take time. Multiplayer still needs lots of work, so again, don't hold your breath!

> 
> While I can see how even more spaceplane parts would appeal to some and might be needed, can we have the pure space parts (You know kerbal SPACE program?) given some love first?
> An ever increasing set of parts to improve design options for atmospheric flight does nothing for many players except increase their memory footprint.
> 
> Once we get a stable 64 bit version then we need ALL the parts of course.
> 
> Until then?
> 
> Not so much.
> 
> That said, these look like some sweet parts for those who focus on spaceplanes.

As much as more rocket parts would be nice, we still need structural parts much more then more engines/fuel tanks. Right now base building, vehicles, heck even capital ships are bloody hard to make with the lack of larger parts. Also, i think we have enough rocket parts, what more could we use anyways aside from 5m parts or the like? There is enough engines, fuel tanks, and other assorted parts catering to rocket builders? Well maybee some think we need more, but i feel the airplane specific and rocket specific categories are already pretty filled. More parts are always welcome (provided some optimization is done to cut down ram hogginess of KSP), but i think that those 2 categories are plenty filled, all we need is more structural parts to let us make bigger bases, warships, ect.
